Package executor

Class ExecutionUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • executor.ExecutionUnit
  • public class ExecutionUnit
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the "brain" of the application. Implements the "Controller" aspect of the MVC pattern. An ExecutionUnit object dictates how should data in storage should be manipulated according to the given command.

    Should the need arise e.g. too many commands, this is the first place to look at for a refactoring. Easiest way is to abstract out the switch statement and make a Command class. Right now it's simple enough to not require an abstraction.

      • clearStorage

        public void clearStorage()
        Clears TaskList. This will irreversibly delete content of TaskList, as well as storage file.

      • executeCommand

        public java.lang.String[] executeCommand​(java.lang.String query)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Executes the given query. Query will be parsed and executed. May throw a BobCatException
        Parameters:
        query - The query to run on TaskList
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - May throw IOException if given storagePath during initialisation is inappropriate
